snippet: The E.P.A. proposed sound rules that would force petroleum refiners to reduce the amount of sulfur in gasoline. The White House should put politics aside and review them.
abstract: Editorial encourages Pres Obama to embrace Environmental Protection Agency proposal to force petroleum refiners to reduce the amount of sulfur in gasoline by two-thirds, change that would result in substantial cuts in soot and smog-forming pollutants from automobile tailpipes.
lead_paragraph: The E.P.A. proposed sound rules that would force petroleum refiners to reduce the amount of sulfur in gasoline. The White House should put politics aside and review them.
